citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Cleaning. There is a buildup of dirt and grime on the perches, bars, and walls in the indoor enclosures (winter quarters)
housing the white-throated capuchin and the two ring-tailed lemurs. Accumulations of dirt and grime on surfaces can
increase disease hazards, odors, and soiling of the animals. Perches, bars, and walls must be kept clean to protect the
health of the non-human primates. Correct by April 21, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.84 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Cleaning. There is a buildup of dirt and grime on the perches, bars, and walls in the indoor enclosures (winter quarters) 
housing the white-throated capuchin and the two ring-tailed lemurs. Accumulations of dirt and grime on surfaces can 
increase disease hazards, odors, and soiling of the animals. Perches, bars, and walls must be kept clean to protect the 
health of the non-human primates. Correct by April 21, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
